pros: Great colleagues to work with.
cons: State funding has traditionally been tight

pros: Kind coworkers and enjoyed working with people. Opportunities for advancement

pros: Beautiful Campus to walk around.
cons: No room for job growth.

pros: The people are wonderful and very supportive
cons: I can’t really think of any cons to share.

pros: Wonderful people and great leadership.

pros: Great coworkers and staff who are dedicated to serving students! Current managers are great people who care for staff.
cons: University staff morale is low overall.

pros: Small campus and good environment

pros: family, community, all in, care

pros: everyone is good at there

pros: Reasonable salaries, but raises do not keep up with cost of living.

Struggling to find university identity. 
Slow management response to rapidly changing environment.

review_title: Bosses are amazing, kind of lame school.
pros:
All of the BSW are amazing.
They treat everyone with respect and teach you how to work.
They do not mess with school or sports time.
cons: The administrative staff or "big wigs" are pretty wacky. They had their school almost go under, only to be saved by students taking a chance. The budget isn't being utilized to help faculty with supplies or needs, it is used for moving a statue 200 feet over for no reason. Just one example...

pros: Flexibility in your ability to cover information.

family/community environment

pros:
they say its good benefits but it does take a bit of your salary to use them so if you're married its a good job for the benefits
Depending on your department you are in you might be with wonderful people

Low pay - student workers will make more eventually
 irregular days of work 
the head of the library acts as if he listens but you won't recieve much acknowledgement for your contributions or change when you add suggestions or demands
you will have to do your job and someone elses without cross training and extra pay

review_title: You learn so much but the work environment…
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Charleston, IL
pros: You will learn how to work with lots of different equipment and get a mountain of experience on different projects. Great advice and structuring of your thesis work from advisors.
cons: The work environment is rough to say the least. So much sexism towards the very few women staffed, sexual harassment from other graduate students within the program is commonplace. Difficult and messy management from the supervisor. So much micromanagement, specifically for the women on staff. The town is also unwelcoming to people with more liberal views and people of color.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Charleston, IL
pros: Charleston is a small town with friendly and accommodating people.
cons: I have not noticed any yet.

pros: Clean, friendly, and all around great. From staff to students this is a great place.
cons: Weather, which isn't controlled by EIU

pros: Was able to work with several faculty and staff in three different departments/offices.
cons: None that I can think of.

job_title: Assistant Director Admissions in Charleston, IL
pros: Great benefits and job security
cons: Higher education is experiencing many changes and challenges

review_title: Okay place to work at but only for a couple of years.
job_title: Administrative Graduate Assistant in Charleston, IL
pros:
1) Living around Charleston is fairly cheap.
2) Depending on the department you work at, you get to meet great minds. 
3) Not a lot of bureaucracy
cons:
1) Lots of discrimination from higher ups 
2) Lack of clear hierarchy/structure
3) The culture wasn't the greatest. 
4) Unfair wages for GAs across departments.

job_title: Food Service Manager in Chicago, IL
pros: Nice staff, friendly customers, overall good settings
cons: Not much pay that’s all

job_title: Youth Ambassador in Forest Park, IL
pros: Professors are nice and schedules are based on your classes
cons: Covid has changed everything for the worst!

job_title: Instructor of Music in Charleston, IL
pros:
- Great colleagues and students
- Nice facility with ample space
cons:
- Budget constraints (no money for professional development)
- Preference given to Unit A (tenure-track and tenured) faculty
- Expected to do a lot for little/no additional money

pros: Very good university to work in
cons: very small town to live in

pros: Benefits, Staff, PTO, Hours, Network
cons: Salary, COVID handling, advancement, Charleston

pros: good benefits, good people, great living conditions
cons: sometimes members on this staff have been here forever and are very stuck in their ways

pros: Job security, affordable health care
cons: Subject to political agenda of current Govenor

pros: Good mentorship and supportive environment
cons: Nothing I can think of

pros: Lovely environment and people to work
cons: None that I can think of

pros: Team oriented, talented, dedicated staff and faculty. Lovely campus. Awesome students - really! What has happened here is tragic for the university and for the surrounding small towns. New Prez.
cons: The withholding of state funds has decimated this beautiful semi-rural campus in downstate Illinois causing the local economy to crater. Cronyism & turf protection run rampant in the face of seriously diminishing resources.

review_title: Very friendly environment, employers, and co-workers
job_title: Geographer (With Earth Science and GIS) in Charleston, IL
pros: Each department have their own work environment. The geography/geology department is very friendly, open, and pleasing.  The people work well together, very social, and helpful to others (inside and outside the department).
cons: I have worked in other departments (the food court) and are not very fair to student workers.  They tend to look down onto the students and only allow them to work short and small amount of hours.  The benefits that you receive as a student worker is just a hourly pay and the low level of student insurance.  Not very much fun, friendliness, and not enjoyable.

review_title: A nice deal for out of state students
pros:
Only required to work 18 hours a week, but often worked much fewer
Faculty had planned out work for GA and were quite flexible and accommodating to work for
Even with 4 classes each semester I was not overwhelmed
Tuition waiver was good
Stipend on top was nice too
cons:
Some research and grunt work for faculty is boring and repetitive
Does not help much in giving you work experience that you can take into the business world

pros: Ability to work in related areas and topics outside of specialty.  Small enough that you know most of the key people that are relevant to completing your job efficiently.  Wonderful benefits
cons: Lack of professional advancement opportunities or a designed system of advancement.  Great salaries for the area but not competitive on a national scale for salaries.

review_title: Working for Eastern Illinois has helped me become a better person. I would recommend them to ANYONE!
pros: Great benefits, excellent people, down to earth attitude with minimal B.S.
cons: The campus is located in a less-populated area making creature comforts like shopping malls a bit of a drive. If you can survive without those malls, you can surly rough it here.

review_title: Best you can do for the area
pros: Easily the best employer in the area with benefits and some form of stability. Freedom to explore ideas and consult with friendly faculty.
cons: Small minded environment mixed with a few big thinkers. Frustrating if you are wanting to make a difference, but ok as a stepping stone.

review_title: State university, used to stable. Now not so much
pros: Largest best paying employer in the county.
cons:
Mind numbing bureaucracy. After the buildings and equipment are learned kind of repetitive. 
Personal initiative discouraged.

pros: Eastern is a beautiful campus with tons of resources for its students. The workplace environment is quite relaxed and the diversity makes it a great place to grow.
cons: Eastern Illinois University is located in a very small rural town, so that is one thing to consider. Additionally, while the work environment may be nice it's not so great for your personal life.

pros: Eastern is truly a community within itself. Once immersed in the campus in some way or another, you will immediately find that everyone is extremely welcoming. There is diversity all around and everyone has a different story which actually brings the people closer together. Truly a great place to be. I both attended and worked a few camps there and would not have chosen any other place than EIU.
cons: It's not a highly populated area so life other than the campus location is boring.

job_title: Gregg Triad Lab Assistant in Charleston, IL
pros: EIU has a lot of different employment opportunities. This one is a hidden gem. Available to student with nice hours(20 max as all university jobs), and has nothing to do with food.
cons: You take a small aptitude test to get hired; fixing simple computer issues,simple application knowledge on office and Dreamweaver, and computer hardware. So those with no technical knowledge it might be difficult. It can also be a little boring.

pros: Great place to work. Great job to have while working on your graduate degree. Very sensitive to  work school balance. Nice resume builder. Great job also if you plan to continue in field of higher ed.
cons: Only real con for this company is that they are dependent on the State of Illinois for a large part of the school fiscal budget. If they offer you the job, I would definitely advise you to take it.

pros:
reasonable salary PLUS tuition reimbursement. Everyone I talked to about this job was satisfied (or better) with the job, duties, and etc.

One of the few schools worldwide that offers masters level graduate assistance-ships.
cons: can not pick up any other work while holding this job - you need to focus on your studies and the work they are providing - you probably wont need to>

review_title: Great job! Faculty are very friendly and work wasn't too challenging.
pros: Slow paced, great work life balance. The company culture is extremely friendly. Everyone who works at the school are willing to extend themselves to help in any way possible.
cons: Often times there wasn't enough work to do. Compensation was sufficient, but you will live the life of a broke college student.

review_title: (Student Worker) Very good part time work for students
job_title: Resident Network Support Staff in Charleston, IL
pros:
* Flexible hours
* Management is great to work with
* Easygoing, lighthearted work environment
* Decent amount of downtime to study or do homework
* You essentially set your own hours around class schedule
cons:
* Pay is minimum wage
* Beginning of each semester and finals weeks can be very stressful
* Not really anything else bad to say!

review_title: Eastern Illinois University is a great place to work for.
pros: There is a very helpful staff with many networking opportunities. They provided me with my own office, laptop, and printer.
cons: I was given little guidance at first as to my specific job responsibilities, however these were later resolved. This could also be a pro..

pros: The university exists in Charleston, IL where the population is not dense; therefore, it is easy to be a graduate assistant there.  since there is no crowd, you can focus on your works easily. Besides, the professors are very helpful. They want the students get for their best.
cons: Place and campus are boring. There is nothing to do.

pros: Graduate assistant position is a great way to fund your education while gaining valuable experience. EIU has e relatively high professor to studemt ratio and easy access to your profs and instructors
cons: Certain colleges, majors, and degree fields have better reputations and therefore better career potential than others. You can learn a lot here, with a little effort

job_title: Dining At Stevenson in Bourbonnais, IL
pros: I worked for Dining Services, Stevenson Tower specifically, and I had a good experience. The work is easy, I made great friends, and loved all the cooks that you work with.
cons: It is not the most exciting job and sometimes the management can be annoying. Stevo does have a bit stricter rules than the other halls.

pros: I worked as a Graduate Assistant in one of the departments . Great people to work with! Very responsive and everyone likes to help. I worked
cons: Charleston is very cold. No means of public transport. Difficult to move around if you do not have a car. No great night life. Boring when students are on vacattion

pros: The university itself has been great to me. The campus is nice, and the facilities -- especially the gym -- are great.
cons: The state has not passed a budget, which has resulted in many staff layoffs. The city of Charleston has also not been managed as well as it has in the past.

pros: The university itself has been great to me. The campus is nice, and the facilities -- especially the gym -- are great.
cons: The state has not passed a budget, which has resulted in many staff layoffs. The city of Charleston has also not been managed as well as it has in the past.

job_title: Tech Support Specialist in Paris, IL
pros: Great teams within small pockets, good satisfaction of job duties
cons: Everyone is out to prove they are more worthy of having a job than you, lack of funding and reduced enrollment causing major issues. Layoffs recently have effected moral.

review_title: Great at education, great student work opportunities, possibility of working full time.
pros: Got my degree and worked as a night assistant during school. Few but very rewarding careers and amazing faculty and staff
cons: Low pay and few hours

pros: Flexible work schedules. Library is open for most of the day, so hours are always available. Staff are all friendly and helpful.
cons: Working in a library means that you must remain quiet. On slow days they will send you out to dust bookcases.

job_title: Department Office Manager in Charleston, IL
pros: Good pay, great benefits, varied, interesting work, and you work with variety of people, department chairs, professors, students, other office staff
cons: Instability at this time, 2018, subject to funding from State of Illinois - budget cuts cause job cuts.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Charleston, IL
pros: Good place to study and work, Great tutors, mostly of hands on the job training
cons: I hope the pay could be improved considering the rate of work students put in

review_title: A great opportunity to learn research skills
pros: The professors were friendly and the pay wasn't bad. Plus a tuition waiver is nice.
cons: The workload can be a bit staggering, especially with graduate work on top of it all.

review_title: Tarble Arts Center at Eastern Illinois University
job_title: Graduate Assistant & Gallery Assistant in Charleston, IL
pros: The design experience I received as a graduate assistant and undergraduate student worker were amazing.
cons: Lack of communication between departments. The pushback my department got about everything we did.

pros: Gain management experience as a student
cons: Limited hours due to state laws of college students working a maximum amount of hours per pay period.

review_title: Working with Eastern was the best experience
job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Charleston, IL
pros: I was able to develop my skills and professional experiences as a teacher, researcher, and administrative assistant.
cons: I hold no reservation against the institution.

review_title: Graduate Assistant in the School of Technology
pros: Eastern is a great school and they have a lot to offer
cons: It can get a bit cold and windy in the winter

review_title: Okay, and in some departments great.
pros: Good benefit package - many departments on campus have excellent management.
cons: Some departments on campus have poor management.

job_title: Gregg Triad Lab Assistant in Charleston, IL
pros:
- Work around school schedule
- Above minimum wage pay
- Great learning opportunity
- Simple priorities and obligations
cons:
- Work on weekends
- Seasonal

pros:
It's very convenient in location
They're flexible with your schedule 
They give you options on where you'd like to be placed

Always part-time

cons: You can get a little burned out if you do not pay attention to self-care

pros: Good pay and benefits. lots of helpful and friendly co-workers.
cons: I dont really have any complaints or cons about working here.

pros:
Faculty and staff are friendly and helpful to one another
A genuinely welcoming and diverse working environment
cons: Communication between departments can be difficult

pros: Friendly faculty and staff. Very easy to talk with students.
cons: Unbelievably low pay, even when you have a Ph.D.

pros:

cons: - Working during finals can be hard sometimes

pros: Diverse Environment and Great Education Programs

cons: located in a very small city.

pros: they work with your time table and can exchange shifts with others
cons: you dont work during school breaks

pros: Great creative writing program, amazing stuff, and amazing friendships formed
cons: I've never had a bad experience at EIU.

cons: EVERYTHING was very great and people were very kind
